info.title: MilkBot lactation API
info.description:
## MilkBot Fitting This service uses the MilkBot fitting engine to fit the MilkBot model to lactation data. The returned parameter set can be substituted into the MilkBot equation

((1 - E^((offset - t)/ramp)/2)*scale)/E^(decay X t)

to generate predicted milk production at any time in the lactation, where t is time since calving (in days, DIM=0 at calving) and E is Euler's number.

Simple formulas described at the support URL can calculate persistence, M305, or cumulative milk between dates. For a fuller description of the model see [Quantifying inter-group variability in lactation curve shape and magnitude with the MilkBotÂ® lactation model](https://peerj.com/articles/54/) ## API Keys To use this service, a valid API key must be in a `X-API-Key` header of each request. For a free API Key, contact Jim Ehrlich jehrlich@MilkBot.com ## Priors Tree The fitting process uses Bayesian prior expectations as the expected means and standar deviation of parameter values as well as expected sd of fitting error. If priors are provided, they will be used. Otherwise default values based on breed and parity will be used. Use `GET /priorsTree` to see default priors. The PriorsTree uses a `discriminator` at each node to value lactations to an appropriate `Priors`. ## Customizing - **Priors** It is easy to generate a customized PriorsTree by fitting a training set of lactations, then using the averages from that set as the priors for future fittings. - **Options** The optional `Options` object may be included with a `FittingJob` to control what data is returned. ## Data constraints - Fitting Jobs may exceed the maximum memory available to the fitting function. If that becomes a problem please contact us and we will consider increasing the memory pool. A Workaround is to fit in small batches or as individual lactations.

post.description: Fit a single lactation from the supplied array of  (DIM, milk weight) data pairs.
Fit a group of lactations returning fitted parameter values. If '**_priors_**' are supplied they will be used. Otherwise fitting will be done from defaults.

get.description: Get the current version number of the server

get.summary: Get default tree of prior expectations
get.description: Get the default Priors that will be used if an alternative is not supplied by the user

BadRequest.description: The server could not understand the request due to invalid syntax.

NotFound.description: The server can not find the requested resource.

milk.description: quantity of milk produced in one day in kg

ND.description: Normal distribution described as mean and standard deviation

Lactation.description: A single lactation of any length.

lacKey.description: an identifier to key this lactation. **_lacKey_** values must be unique within a LactationList.

Params.description: Parameter set for the MilkBot model

scale.description: Overall scale of milk production in kg units. The MilkBot® model can be converted to another unit of measurement for milk simply by multiplying the scale parameter by an appropriate conversion factor

ramp.description: Length of ramp-up period at start of lactation, in **days**.

offset.description: Offset between calving and theoretical start of lactation in **days**.

decay.description: first order decay constant in inverse-days that controls the decline in milk production.

milkUnit.description: abbreviated name of  measurement unit for mile quantity lb=pounds, kg=kilograms

PriorsTree.description: Recursive tree structure with a Polymorphic nodes (leaf or branch)

Priors.description: Optional Bayesian prior expectations for use by fitting engine. If not provided, defaults based on breed and parity will be used. **_means_** are the expected mean parameter values for the population and **_sd_** are expected standard deviation of parameter values for the population **_seMilk_** is expected standard error of milk measurements excluding the effects of a normal lactation curve

scale.description: expected distribution of scale parameter in units specified by milkUnit

ramp.description: expected distribution of ramp parameter in days

decay.description: expected distribution of decay parameter in inverse days

offset.description: expected distribution of offset parameter in days

seMilk.description: expected standard deviation of milkweight residuals in units specified by milkUnit

milkUnit.description: abbreviated name of  measurement unit for mile quantity lb=pounds, kg=kilograms

PriorsLeaf.description: A terminal leaf of a PriorsTree with Priors for fitting a particular class of lactations.

FilterableLeaf.description: a Priorstree with a LacFilter function that can be used to determine whether the node is suitable for a particular lactation.

PriorsBranch.description: A branch in the briorsTree with a list containing filterable sub-trees or leaves.

node.description: a list of either sub-trees or leaves to be filtered

fieldName.description: Name of field in input Lactation holding values on which the node list will be filtered

default.description: fallthrough to use if none of the FilterableLeaf items in the this.node array pass the filter

LacFilter.description: Fitiltering function returning a boolean whether the object passes.

value.description: the value a lactation must have in the field specified by the parent PriorsBranch.fieldName to pass the filter

NumberMatch.description: matches lactations with  a number equal to the value of the NumberMatch.

value.description: the value a lactation must have in the field specified by the parent PriorsBranch.fieldName to pass the filter

EqualOrGreater.description: matches lactations with  a number equal to or greater than the value of the EqualOrGreater.

value.description: the value a lactation must have >= in the field specified by the parent PriorsBranch.fieldName to pass the filter

EqualOrLess.description: matches lactations with  a number equal to or greater than the value of the EqualOrGreater.

value.description: the value a lactation must have <= in the field specified by the parent PriorsBranch.fieldName to pass the filter

StringMatch.description: matches lactations with  a string equal to the value of the NumberMatch, ignoring case.

value.description: the value a lactation must have in the field specified by the parent PriorsBranch.fieldName to pass the filter

FittingJob.description: A set of lactations to fit with optional priors tree and fit options..

FittingResult.description: the result of fitting a FittingJob, structured according to the FitOption.

LactationSet.description: A set of lactations with optional milk unit (Kg is default).

name.description: name for this group of lactations, such as herd name or group

FitOptions.description: Options to be used in fitting and returning results

returnInputData.description: return the lactation milk point data along with the fitted parameters

returnPath.description: return fitted parameters for each iteration of the fitting process

returnDiscriminatorPath.description: return the discriminator path showing how priors were selected

fitEngine.description: name of fitting engine to use

fitObjective.description: name of the fitting objective to use

preferredMilkUnit.description: abbreviated name of preferred measurement unit for mile quantity lb=pounds, kg=kilograms

Fit.description: Data returned for a fitted lactation

nPoints.description: number of milk points in lactation

distance.description: A measure of fit quality, lower distance indicates a better fit

errorType.description: a URI identifier that categorizes the error

title.description: A brief, human-readable message about the error

detail.description: a human-readable description of the specific error
detail.example: Authentication failed due to incorrect username or password.

instance.description: a URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the error
